name: Bubble Membrane
imageDescription: A spinning hemispherical membrane bubble with liquid droplet sprayers cooling hot coolant via centrifugal force, with a collection trough at the bottom.

name: Electrostatic Membrane
imageDescription: A large elliptical electrostatic field membrane radiator with a central mast, pumping coolant through a thin transparent membrane using electrostatic forces.

name: Dielectric X-ray Window
imageDescription: A toroidal fusion reactor with poloidal and toroidal field magnets and central solenoid, featuring a dielectric window transparent to bremsstrahlung X-rays allowing heat to escape to space.

name: Graphene Crystal X-ray Mirror
imageDescription: A layered graphene nano-film structure reflecting bremsstrahlung X-rays back into the plasma via Bragg reflection, with an iridium lattice and X-ray standing wave nodes.

name: ETHER Charged Dust
imageDescription: Hot charged particles circulate within an external magnetic field, using a Van de Graaff electrostatic dust charger to create circulating charged-dust paths between positive and negative poles.

name: Curie Point
imageDescription: Molten iron droplets ejected in a sheet regain their magnetism as they cool below the Curie point in space, allowing magnetic recovery by an electromagnetic broom.

name: Li Heatsink Fountain
ability: Switch to light side after 1st use.
imageDescription: A lithium fountain radiator where lithium undergoes phase changes as it is heated from 50K to 1800K, sprayed forward by piezoelectric droplet sprayers, then cooled and recovered with containment magnets.

name: Thermochemical Heatsink Fountain
ability: Switch to light side after 1st use.
imageDescription: A 40 tonne block of MgSO4-7H2O undergoes phase changes heated to 3100K, with SO3 condenser and steam condenser recovery systems, graphite-lined tungsten tank, and shadow shield.

name: Magnetocaloric Refrigerator
ability: This card can cool its own supports.
imageDescription: A magnetocaloric rotating wheel with permanent magnets magnetically pumps heat to a tungsten-coated radiator, capable of cooling its own structural supports.

name: Nuclear Fuel Spin Polarizer
imageDescription: A device with ferromagnetic spin injector and detector on a graphene sheet with quantum tunneling insulator, treating fusion fuels to reduce neutron emissions and thus reduce the heat load.

name: Microtube Array
imageDescription: Evaporating fluid pulls liquid through Pt-coated oxidized metal piping with wick and slug systems, featuring a reservoir with cold bias heater and bayonet cross section evaporator.

name: Marangoni Flow
imageDescription: A bubble-based radiator that moves heat using differences in surface tensions, with Marangoni convection cells circulating fluid from the hot heat source to the cold exterior.

name: Mo/Li Heat Pipe
imageDescription: Molybdenum-lithium heat pipe radiator with high temperature capability.

name: Tin Droplet
imageDescription: Drops of molten tin ejected into space cool before recovery, with a tin droplet generator, heat exchanger, pitot tube fluid collection, and centrifugal Sn collector.

name: Qu Tube
imageDescription: A solid state hermetically sealed copper pipe that superconducts heat, with anti-corrosion, black powder, and active layers each 8-12 micrometers thick around a 0.9mm pipe wall.

name: ANDR/In Dream Pipe
imageDescription: ANDR-Indium dream pipe heat transfer system.

name: SS/NaK Pumped Loop
imageDescription: Stainless steel sodium-potassium pumped loop radiator.

name: Hula-Hoop
imageDescription: Rotating mesh rings entrain hot gallium fluid and cool it away from the spacecraft, with 50m braided cermet hoops, labyrinth seal, and drive mechanism around a hot Ga bath.

name: Salt-cooled Reflux Tube
imageDescription: A reflux tube that spins to circulate molten fluoride salts as working fluid, with woven C-C fabric surface, Ti liner, evaporator, condenser, and C-C fins.

name: Buckytube Filament
imageDescription: Carbon nanofiber loops (12,000 filaments, 70m each) cycle between a heat source and space, revolving around rollers on a stationary drum with meteoroid shield and longitudinal flow passage.

name: Steel/Pb-Bi Pumped Loop
imageDescription: Steel lead-bismuth pumped loop radiator system.

name: Pulsating Heat Pipe
imageDescription: Oscillating liquid plugs and vapor bubbles efficiently transport heat through adiabatic sections between condenser and evaporator, with filling valve and serpentine tubing containing liquid slugs.

name: Ti/K Heat Pipe
imageDescription: Titanium-potassium heat pipe radiator.

name: Flux-pinned Superthermal
imageDescription: Variable configuration radiators using superconducting graphite foam elements in a flux-pinned formation, linked by superthermal ribbon in a wavy sheet configuration.
